name: Box Goblet Squat
setup: Position box or bench at desired depth (usually knee-height or slightly lower)
Hold bell at chest (horns for KB or one end of DB), forearms vertical
Brace lightly and keep ribs stacked over pelvis
steps: Inhale, sit hips back slightly and bend knees to descend
Track knees over mid-foot; keep torso tall and elbows pointing down
Lower until hips touch box/bench lightly—don't collapse onto it
Pause briefly on contact, maintaining tension
Exhale, drive through mid-foot/heels to stand tall
Finish with glutes squeezed softly, ribs down
cues: Elbows down; bell tight to chest
Control the descent, drive up strong
mistakes: Collapsing or sitting fully onto the box
Using box for momentum instead of depth reference
Heels lifting or weight shifting to toes
safety: Box provides depth reference and confidence for those with knee/hip mobility issues. Don't use the box as a crutch—maintain control throughout the movement.

regressions: Higher box for shorter range of motion
progressions: Remove box and perform full goblet squat

prescriptionHints.load: KB 12–20 kg or DB 25–45 lb—lighter than regular goblet squat
prescriptionHints.reps: 8–15 for building confidence and range of motion
prescriptionHints.notes: Focus on consistency and control rather than heavy loading. Box height should allow comfortable depth.

joints.notes: Ideal for those with limited ankle/hip mobility or knee issues. Box provides confidence and depth reference.
